Tasks.Task Description: Create an Azure Storage account to store blobs. This is the foundational step for using Azure Blob Storage.
Specify the type of endpoint (standard or Azure DNS zone) when creating a storage account. This endpoint forms the base address for all objects within the storage account.
Retrieve and set environment variables to connect to the storage account, Computer Vision, and Cosmos DB services.
Install the Azure Blob Storage client library and Azure Identity client library using package managers like npm or pip.
Create an Azure Function that accepts an uploaded file as a blob parameter, analyzes the blob using the Computer Vision service, and inserts the analyzed image text into Cosmos DB.

Tasks.Task: Set up Blob Storage triggers and bindings
Tasks.Task Description: Configure triggers and bindings for the Azure Function to indicate the data expected into or out of the function and the service that will send or receive that data.

Tasks.Task: Use Azure CLI for connection setup
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create a connection between Azure Function and Storage Blob with Service Connector.
Use Visual Studio Code or other tools to deploy the Azure Function to the cloud.
Use the Azure pricing calculator to estimate costs and set up cost management features to monitor and manage spending.
Set up Azure Event Grid to react to Blob Storage events such as creation and deletion of blobs, and route these events to subscribers like Azure Functions or Logic Apps.
